module.name: fabrication_technology
module.keywords: module, fabrication, technology, parameters, templates, patterns, stackup model

abstract.p: the representation of the information needed to describe the properties of the fabrication technology selected for the interconnect substrate being designed. This part of ISO 10303 also supports description of simple and complex templates for layout design. This part of ISO 10303 also supports definition of technology specific layer stackup models able to support multiple material combinations.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the information needed to describe the properties of the fabrication technology selected for the interconnect substrate being designed. This part of ISO 10303 also supports description of simple and complex templates for layout design. This part of ISO 10303 also supports definition of technology specific layer stackup models able to support multiple material combinations.
purpose.note: The stackup model is not limited to one vertical arrangement of material stackup but supports differing material stackup across a substrate.

inscope.li: items within the scope of application module Constructive solid geometry 2d, ISO/TS 10303-1731;
items within the scope of application module Extended geometric tolerance, ISO/TS 10303-1666;
items within the scope of application module Part template 2d shape, ISO/TS 10303-1716;
items within the scope of application module Physical layout template, ISO/TS 10303-1722.

definition.def: an intermediate stage in the reaction of a thermosetting resin in which the material melts when heated and dissolves in certain solvents
a protective, dielectric coating designed to conform to the surface of a PWA or PCA
the final stage of the curing of a thermosetting resin in which the material has become infusible and insoluble in common solvents
a rigid plate with a pattern of voids to create glue patterns during a manufacturing process
a product made by bonding together two or more layers of material or materials
a rigid plate with a pattern of voids used to create solder paste patterns during a manufacturing process. Solder paste is deposited only where there are voids in the plate
a material layer realized by transferring an image to a surface by forcing suitable media through a stencil screen with a squeegee
an insulating layer of a PCB or PWB that exposes only the areas to be soldered
a specially blended paste consisting of carefully graded solder powder particles, and a flux medium designed to give the paste particular printing and reflow characteristics
A combination of mat, fabric, nonwoven material, or roving with resin, usually advanced to the B-stage, ready for curing
material flow properties intermediate between liquids and solids
one layer of material in the sequence of materials that compose a PCB, and that usually has an aspect ratio that is very large, typically 1,000:1
